result.execSummary:
The defendant Paula R. Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paula R. Boyd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paula R. Boyd was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Paula R. Boyd was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Paula R. Boyd was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Paula R. Boyd in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Cont of Sentencing hearing due to lack of contact with the writer of the PSI.  Victim rights are complied with.  Court recaps the issues.  Parties did review the PSI.  Arguements heard due to sentencing.  Deft makes a statement to the court. Court takes a break to review the files and notes.  Return at 10:45 am  Back on the record at 11:01 am.  Court to give it ruling.

1 year probation - Imposed

DNA sample unless already done.
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
conditions as set forth on Page 19 of PSI.

Defendant Paula R. Boyd in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Sentencing of Counts 1-3. Video was played by the State.  Court to adjourn the sentencing do to lack of time.  Joseph Winter (friend of Paula) makes a statement to the court.  Bond to stay in force.  Review scheduled for April 29, 2016.

Defendant Paula R. Boyd in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called Appearances given @ 8:33 AM  Need to verify that that the Motions in Limine - defense were heard.  State also needs a motions for the number of priors.  State requests the court to review the file.   Court to follow the numbering that is on the amended information.  State names 2 possible 3 witnesses.  Defense has no witnesses for the trial today.  Court to hear motions after the jury selection is complete.    Adjourn to convene in Br 1 for jury selection.  Court recalls the case at 9:06 am.  for jury selection.  Jury selection completed at 9:50 am.  Court reviews Defense Motion.  Jurors are brought into the court room at 10:25 am.  Court gives the preliminary jury instructions.  Opening statements 10:34 am.  Opening statements complete at 10:47 am.  Notepads handed out to the jurors.  John Janikowski  duly sworn and testifies.  Sidebar 10:49 am - questioning by the state - past contacts.  Jurors excused due to a sidebar that needs to be discussed  5 minute recess for court to review.  Back on the record at 11:19 am.  The witness is brought back into court. Court rules on the sidebar, questions the witness.  Court rules no miss trial at this point due to questioning by the state.  No more reference to past contacts by the State.  Id'd deft.  One written question from juror  2nd question from the jury Break for lunch at 12:30 be back at 1:30 pm.  Jurors back 1:41 pm  Jessica Long  duly sworn and testifies. Jurors excused at 2:49 pm.  regarding report written by JL.  JL Id'd the deft.  Kurt Perra  duly sworn and testifies.  State rest at 3:39 pm.  Jurors excused at 3:39 pm.  Court addresses the deft regarding her to testify.  FVI  Back on the record regarding the Jury Instruction 4:23 pm.  Jurors back 4:25 pm  Court reads the jury instructions  state gives closing arguements.  Oath given to the Bailiff's.  Juror's excused to deliberate at 5:28 pm.  Court recites the sidebars.

Jurors have a verdict 5:45 pm Jurors in the courtroom at 5:53 pm  Verdict given.  Defense want the jurors polled.

State dismisses outright Counts 6 & 7.0

Deft enters a plea of no contest to counts 2 & 3.  Court reviews the Plea Questionaire / Waiver of rights in regards to these two counts.  FVI

State asking to be heard on bond and is requesting a $5,000 cash bond.  Court reviews the file  No PSI to be ordered at this time.  Court orders $500 cash bond  $500 signature bond w/standard conditions.  Ms Boyd has until 4:00 pm on 12/15 15 to post the $500 or report to jail by 4:00 pm on 12/15/15

State's motion to exclude witnesses and Defense motion to  exclude.  The state's motion to  exclude witnesses is withdrawn by the state.  The motion applied to a prior jury date and time.  

Court hears motion to sever charges.  Arguements heard.  Court discusses the bail jump charges.  If found guilty 1-4 then to plea to Count 5-7 if found not guilty at trial then the bail jump charges will be dismissed.  Deft understands this and agrees to this.
